perturbation.original_text: 3. Sponsorship Fee. The Sponsor shall pay to Racing a sponsorship fee in the amount of $750,000.00 for the term of this Agreement, payable  in an initial installment payable on or before February 1, 2010 in the amount of $350,000.00 and ten installments of $40,000.00 on or before the first  day of each month commencing March 1, 2010 and ending with the installment due on December 1, 2010 (unless this Agreement is sooner  terminated pursuant to Section 14 hereof, in which case Sponsor shall have no obligation to make any payments after the date of termination).
perturbation.changed_text: 3. Sponsorship Fee. The Sponsor shall pay to Racing a sponsorship fee in the amount of $750,000.00 for the term of this Agreement, payable  in an initial installment payable on or before February 1, 2010 in the amount of $350,000.00 and ten installments of $40,000.00 on or before the first  day of each month commencing March 1, 2010 and ending with the installment due on December 1, 2010 (unless this Agreement is sooner  terminated pursuant to Section 14 hereof).
perturbation.explanation: The original text clearly states that if the agreement is terminated, the sponsor has no further obligation to make payments after the date of termination. By removing the clause "in which case Sponsor shall have no obligation to make any payments after the date of termination", it creates an ambiguity about the sponsor's payment obligation upon termination. This directly contradicts the termination clause (Section 14) which outlines Sponsor obligations. It is now unclear if sponsor needs to continue payments or not.

perturbation.original_text: 5. Sponsor's Maximum Obligation; Indemnification. Racing represents to the Sponsor that the Sponsor's aggregate obligation hereunder  will not exceed the amount of the sponsorship fee set forth in Section 3 hereof (or such lesser amount as is payable by the Sponsor in the event  that this Agreement is terminated pursuant to Section 14 hereof), plus, if applicable, collection costs that may be reasonably incurred by Racing in  a legal proceeding to collect all or any part thereof (the "Maximum Obligation"). Racing agrees to indemnify the Sponsor and its officers, directors,  agents and employees and to hold them harmless from any loss, claim, cost, damage or liability in excess of the Maximum Obligation which (i) the  Sponsor shall incur as a result of this Agreement, or (ii) arises from any failure by Racing to perform any of its obligations hereunder.

Racing agrees to indemnify the Sponsor and its officers, directors,  agents and employees and to hold them harmless from any loss, claim, cost, damage or liability in excess of the Maximum Obligation which (i) the  Sponsor shall incur as a result of this Agreement, or (ii) arises from any failure by Racing to perform any of its obligations hereunder.

The original text clarifies that the 'Maximum Obligation' can be reduced upon termination, but the edited text implies that the sponsor is always liable for the full sponsorship fee regardless of termination. It contradicts Section 14's clause on termination where sponsor has no further obligation.

perturbation.original_text: 14. Termination by the Sponsor. Notwithstanding the provisions of Section 1 hereof, the Sponsor shall have the right at any time prior to  December 31, 2010 to terminate this Agreement by giving written notice of such termination to Racing. In the event of such a termination, (i) the  Sponsor shall have no further obligation to make payments toward the sponsorship fee contemplated in Section 3 hereof, (ii) Racing shall have no  further obligation to provide any Benefits hereunder, and (iii) the remaining provisions of this Agreement shall remain in full force and effect.
